definition.para: Prominent date for the resource, such as the date of creation of the original resource.

instructions.para: Reflects the date in the "Date" field.
Express all dates, including date ranges, using Library of Congress' Extended Date Time Format.
The most recent version of the Library of Congress' summary of EDTF is available at https://www.loc.gov/standards/datetime/.
Six formats are recommended for values in Date, each corresponding to a specific EDTF format:
If the value of Date is YYYY, enter YYYY.
If the value of Date is YYYY?, enter YYYY?
If the value of Date is [month] DD, YYYY, enter YYYY-MM-DD.
If the value of Date is [month], YYYY, enter YYYY-MM.
If the value of Date is between YYYY and YYYY, enter YYYY/YYYY.
If the value of Date is between YYYY and YYYY?, enter YYYY?/YYYY?
If the value of Date is not any of the above, consult the EDTF specification to determine the appropriate notation.
Date-Edtf value should agree with dates values entered in Date and Dates fields.
Reflects the date in the "Date" field.
Express all dates, including date ranges, using Library of Congress' Extended Date Time Format.
The most recent version of the Library of Congress' summary of EDTF is available at https://www.loc.gov/standards/datetime/.
Six formats are recommended for values in Date, each corresponding to a specific EDTF format:
If the value of Date is YYYY, enter YYYY.
If the value of Date is YYYY?, enter YYYY?
If the value of Date is [month] DD, YYYY, enter YYYY-MM-DD.
If the value of Date is [month], YYYY, enter YYYY-MM.
If the value of Date is between YYYY and YYYY, enter YYYY/YYYY.
If the value of Date is between YYYY and YYYY?, enter YYYY?/YYYY?
If the value of Date is not any of the above, consult the EDTF spedification to determine the appropriate notation.
Date-Edtf value should agree with dates values entered in Date and Dates fields.

customization.para: Reflects the date in the "Date" field.
Express all dates, including date ranges, using Library of Congress' Extended Date Time Format.
Creating well-formed values for resources in the Sephardic Studies Digital Collection may require first converting date values from lunar to Gregorian calendar systems.
The most recent version of the Library of Congress' summary of EDTF is available at https://www.loc.gov/standards/datetime/.
Six formats are recommended for values in Date, each corresponding to a specific EDTF format:
If the value of Date is YYYY, enter YYYY.
If the value of Date is YYYY?, enter YYYY?
If the value of Date is [month] DD, YYYY, enter YYYY-MM-DD.
If the value of Date is [month], YYYY, enter YYYY-MM.
If the value of Date is between YYYY and YYYY, enter YYYY/YYYY.
If the value of Date is between YYYY and YYYY?, enter YYYY?/YYYY?
If the value of Date is not any of the above, consult the EDTF spedification to determine the appropriate notation.
Date-Edtf value should agree with dates values entered in Date and Dates fields.
Date of creation of the original resource.

Reflects the date in the "Date of Broadcast" field.
Express all dates, including date ranges, using Library of Congress' Extended Date Time Format.
The most recent version of the Library of Congress' summary of EDTF is available at https://www.loc.gov/standards/datetime/.
Six formats are recommended for values in Date of Broadcast, each corresponding to a specific EDTF format:
If the value of Date of Broadcast is YYYY, enter YYYY.
If the value of Date of Broadcast is YYYY?, enter YYYY?
If the value of Date of Broadcast is [month] DD, YYYY, enter YYYY-MM-DD.
If the value of Date of Broadcast is [month], YYYY, enter YYYY-MM.
If the value of Date of Broadcast is between YYYY and YYYY, enter YYYY/YYYY
If the value of Date of Broadcast is between YYYY and YYYY?, enter YYYY?/YYYY?
If the value of Date of Broadcast is not any of the above, consult the EDTF spedification to determine the appropriate notation.
Date-Edtf value should agree with dates values entered in Date of Broadcast and Dates fields.
Enter the date that applies to the overall object. This date will likely represent the years the program was broadcast.
Reflects the date in the "Date of Broadcast" field.
Express all dates, including date ranges, using Library of Congress' Extended Date Time Format.
The most recent version of the Library of Congress' summary of EDTF is available at https://www.loc.gov/standards/datetime/.
Six formats are recommended for values in Date of Broadcast, each corresponding to a specific EDTF format:
If the value of Date of Broadcast is YYYY, enter YYYY.

If the value of Date of Broadcast is [month] DD, YYYY, enter YYYY-MM-DD.

If the value of Date of Broadcast is not any of the above, consult the EDTF spedification to determine the appropriate notation.
Date-Edtf value should agree with dates values entered in Date of Broadcast and Dates fields.
Enter the date that applies to the item.
Reflects the date in the "Date of Broadcast" field.
Express all dates, including date ranges, using Library of Congress' Extended Date Time Format.
The most recent version of the Library of Congress' summary of EDTF is available at https://www.loc.gov/standards/datetime/.
Six formats are recommended for values in Date of Broadcast, each corresponding to a specific EDTF format:
If the value of Date of Broadcast is YYYY, enter YYYY.
If the value of Date of Broadcast is YYYY?, enter YYYY?
If the value of Date of Broadcast is [month] DD, YYYY, enter YYYY-MM-DD.
If the value of Date of Broadcast is [month], YYYY, enter YYYY-MM.
If the value of Date of Broadcast is between YYYY and YYYY, enter YYYY/YYYY
If the value of Date of Broadcast is between YYYY and YYYY?, enter YYYY?/YYYY?
If the value of Date of Broadcast is not any of the above, consult the EDTF spedification to determine the appropriate notation.
Date-Edtf value should agree with dates values entered in Date of Broadcast and Dates fields.
Record a value for the Date field prior to recording this value.
Reformat the Date field value to express the value using the Library of Congress Extended Date Time Format (EDTF). The most recent version of EDTF is available online.
Reformat the Date value as follows:
If the value of Date is “YYYY”, enter “YYYY”.
If the value of Date is “YYYY?”, enter “YYYY?”.
If the value of Date is “[month] YYYY” enter “YYYY-MM”.
If the value of Date is “[month] DD, YYYY”, enter “YYYY-MM-DD".
If the value of Date is “between YYYY and YYYY”, enter “YYYY/YYYY”.
If the value of Date is “between [month] YYYY and [month] YYYY”, enter “YYYY-MM/YYYY-MM”.
If the value of Date is " between [month] DD, YYYY and [month] DD, YYYY”, enter “YYYY-MM-DD/YYYY-MM-DD".
If the value of Date is “between YYYY and YYYY?”, enter “YYYY?/YYYY?”.
If the value of Date is not as in any of the above examples, use the EDTF specification to format a value, and/or contact the collection manager or metadata liaison.

example.para: If the Date field = "1940" then Date EDTF = "1940"
If the Date field = "1910?" then Date EDTF = "1910?"
If Date field = "May 9, 2001" then Date EDTF = "2001-05-09"
If Date field = "January 2008" then Date EDTF = "2008-01"
If Date field = "between 1930 and 1939" then Date EDTF = "1930/1939"
If Date field = "between 1855 and 1999?" then Date EDTF = "1855?/1999?"
If the Date field = "1940" then Date EDTF = "1940"

If Date field = "between 1930 and 1939" then Date EDTF = "1930/1939"
If Date field = "between 1855 and 1999?" then Date EDTF = "1855?/1999?"

[If Date field is “2005”] 2005
[If Date field is “2005?”] 2005?
[If Date field is “March 2005”] 2005-03
[If Date field is “March 11, 2005”] 2005-03-11
[If Date field is “between 2005 and 2006”] 2005/2006
[If Date field is “between January 2005 and February 2005”] 2005-01/2005-02
[If Date field is “between January 15, 2005 and February 01, 2005”] 2005-01-15/2005-02-01
[If Date field is “between 2005 and 2006?”] 2005?/2006?
[If Date field is “2005”] 2005
[If Date field is “2005?”] 2005?
[If Date field is “March 2005”] 2005-03
[If Date field is “March 11, 2005”] 2005-03-11
[If Date field is “between 2005 and 2006”] 2005/2006
[If Date field is “between January 2005 and February 2005”] 2005-01/2005-02
[If Date field is “between January 15, 2005 and February 01, 2005”] 2005-01-15/2005-02-01
[If Date field is “between 2005 and 2006?”] 2005?/2006?

admin.para: For the xsd, datatype is xs:string; the datatype is more accurately http://id.loc.gov/datatypes/edtf, which is not a valid QName and is inavlid according to schema-4-properties, but this does not seem to be machine-actionable; more exploration needed.

history.justification: Wanted to add standardized date forms (EDTF) required by Orbis Cascade Dublin Core Best Practices (https://www.orbiscascade.org/dublin-core-best-practices).

changeLog.change: changed //cdm/required to //cdm/cdmRequired and //cdm/uwRequired to assist in halting use of the cdm "required" feature while, at the same time, indicating that UW-cdm collections must use, or not use, a given property; also changed @xsi:schemaLocation. Also updated link to EDTF and added some instructions.
Add krab customizations and any attendant info to support cdm compound objects for that collection.
Encode EDTF reference URL to output live links to HTML DDs.
Per MIG feedback on 2021-03-25: 1) make dateEdtf searchable = yes 2) map dateEdtf to "date" (was "created"). BMR
Add custom instructions for Sephardic Studies Digital Collection - p16786coll3.
